crochet through the front loop only blo crochet through the back loop only tools and materials ● 6 50 mm k/10½ crochet hook ● tapestry needle and scissors ● polyester fiberfill stuffing ● 1 skein lion brand wool ease thick and quick yarn in color spice ● <1 skein lion brand wool ease thick and quick yarn in color oatmeal ● <1 skein lion brand wool ease thick and quick yarn in color black final size height 17in width 11in gauge and technical notes ● gauge 4 row of 4 single_crochet = 1 5in x 1 5in ● crochet in continuous spiral rounds unless specified otherwise use a stitch marker or piece of yarn to keep track of the last stitch in each round ● when filling with polyester stuffing pull apart each large chunk into many smaller chunks this ensures an even distribution of firmness ● color change tutorial ○ once you reach the last st of the first color orange pictured pause before doing the last yo and pulling through both loops you should have two loops of your first color on your hook ○ take your second color white and pull through both loops on the hook completing the single_crochet ○ continue as normal from there crocheting over the tail from the second color and the yarn from the first when you need to change colors again you will have the yarn that you carried with you to change into if you change into a new color always crochet over the tail to secure it ©2023aybeecreates lankyfoxcrochetpattern ● i like to leave a long tail on every piece of my work and use that to sew pieces together i included an estimate of how much yarn you ll need for the amount of sewing when done sewing hide the tails by tucking them inside the work leaving a couple inches after tying off you can either run the yarn down the body with a needle or use scissors or crochet hook to stuff extra yarn through a gap in the stitches by doing this even if things start to loosen up it s fixable and things won t unravel completely it s extra important for baby and child proofing making the work more durable even for pieces that aren t sewed on don t cut the yarn hide
